required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Internet Based Support (Carer eSupport) for Informal Caregivers of Patients With Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Carer eSupport: Rationale and Design of an Internet-based Support for Informal Caregivers of Individuals With Head and Neck Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Informal caregivers to patients with head and neck cancer report that they are unprepared for caregiving, that they experience a high caregiver burden and a deteriorated health. The aim is to develop an internet based intervention for informal caregivers of individuals with head and neck cancer and evaluate the feasibility and acceptability of the intervention. The internet based intervention (Carer eSupport) will be based on scientific evidence, established theoretical frameworks and focus groups with caregivers and health care professionals. The feasibility and acceptability of Carer eSupport will be evaluated by 30 caregivers who will have access to Carer eSupport during one months. The feasibility and acceptability of Carer eSupport will be evaluated with quantitative and qualitative data.

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of caregivers who give informed consent for participation
The proportion of included caregivers who take use of Carer eSupport
The proportion of included caregivers who withdraw from the study
The proportion of included caregivers who complete questionnaires

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 months after completion of testing Carer eSupport.
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative data from semi-structured individual interviews exploring perceived feasibility of Carer eSupport.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 months after completion of testing Carer eSupport.
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative data from semi-structured individual interviews exploring perceived acceptability of Carer eSupport.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and at 1 months after access to Carer eSupport
secondary_outcome.description: A brief 8-item self-report measure assessing preparedness for caregiving, a potential primary outcome in a future randomized controlled trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and at 1 months after access to Carer eSupport.
secondary_outcome.description: A 22-item self-report measure assessing caregiver burden, a potential primary outcome in a future randomized controlled trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and at 1 months after access to Carer eSupport.
secondary_outcome.description: A 36-item self-report measure assessing self-perceived health, a potential secondary outcome in a future randomized controlled trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and at 1 months after access to Carer eSupport.
secondary_outcome.description: A 21-item self-report measure assessing depression, anxiety, and stress, a potential secondary outcome in a future randomized controlled trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and at 1 months after access to Carer eSupport.
secondary_outcome.description: A 20-item self-report measure assessing five dimensions of fatigue, a potential secondary outcome in a future randomized controlled trial.

arm_group.description: Internet based support for informal caregivers to individuals who are undergoing treatment for head and neck cancer.

intervention.description: Carer eSupport is designed to prepare informal caregivers for caregiving, to decrease caregiver burden and prevent a deteriorated health.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informal caregivers (defined by the patients) to patients with head and neck cancer who are about to start treatment, undergoing treatment or have completed treatment within the past month.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Confusion or dementia, inability to understand, speak or read Swedish.

overall_official.affiliation: Uppsala University, Department of Immunology, Genetics and pathology

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to make individual participant data (IPD) available to other researchers, since this is a feasibility study.
